ground_truth: Carolyn sits at a table, lost in thought, with two menus on the table. After a moment, Buddy Kane, the Real Estate King, joins her, and Carolyn immediately becomes warm and gracious. She smiles, genuinely touched that he remembers her name, and picks up her menu mechanically, continuing to stare at Buddy, enraptured. Ricky stands with his DIGICAM, videotaping a DEAD BIRD decomposing on the ground. The camera jerks up to discover Jane and Angela staring at us, and Angela looks at Jane, trying not to laugh, then falls out of frame as we zoom toward Jane. Ricky lowers the Digicam, and Angela starts off, but Jane doesn't follow while Ricky smiles at her. Angela stops and stares at her. In another scene, Carolyn and Buddy are in the middle of sex. Meanwhile, Lester is driving, smoking a joint in his TOYOTA CAMRY, cruising through the streets. Lester turns down the volume on the stereo, pulls the car around to the WINDOW, where a teenage GIRL wearing a headset is waiting, pays her, and notices a SIGN in the corner of the window as she hands him his food. Lester sits at a booth with the MANAGER, a greasy kid wearing a white short sleeve shirt and a tie covered with the Mr. Smiley's logo, who looks over Lester's application, baffled. Later, Carolyn and Buddy are in bed, post-sex, laughing. Carolyn sits up, eager to learn from the master, and quickly picks up her cue, kissing him and ready for another round. Ricky and Jane walk along without speaking; he seems comfortable with the silence while she doesn't. They stop walking and after a beat, an automobile FUNERAL PROCESSION appears and begins to pass them slowly, which they watch. Barbara Fitts sits at the kitchen table, staring off into space as if hypnotized, while Ricky enters, followed by Jane. Barbara's eyes flutter and she turns to him slowly, with Jane glancing around at the spotless room where GLASS CASES filled with GUNS line the walls. Ricky crosses to a built-in CABINET behind the desk, unlocks it, and opens it, revealing shelves stacked with WAR MEMORABILIA. He reaches into the cabinet, carefully removes an oval CHINA PLATTER, and hands it to Jane, who examines it closely. On the bottom of the plate, a small SWASTIKA is imprinted in the center. Ricky puts the platter back into the cabinet and shuts the door, noticing Jane looking at him oddly, and studies her. Finally, we're in an empty parking lot on a cold, gray day, with something floating across from us: an empty, wrinkled, white PLASTIC BAG.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Carolyn perches at a desk, absorbed in reflection, with two lists on the desk. After a moment, Buddy Kane, the Realty Monarch, joins her, and Carolyn promptly becomes warm and cordial. She grins, genuinely moved that he recalls her designation, and lifts her list mechanically, continuing to gaze at Buddy, captivated. Ricky stands with his DIGICAM, filming a DEAD BIRD decaying on the ground. The camcorder jerks up to discover Jane and Angela gazing at us, and Angela glances at Jane, trying not to chuckle, then falls out of view as we zoom toward Jane. Ricky lowers the Digicam, and Angela starts off, but Jane doesn't follow while Ricky grins at her. Angela halts and gazes at her. In another scene, Carolyn and Buddy are in the middle of lovemaking. Meanwhile, Lester is driving, smoking a joint in his TOYOTA CAMRY, cruising through the avenues. Lester turns down the volume on the stereo, pulls the vehicle around to the WINDOW, where a teenage GIRL wearing a headset is waiting, pays her, and notices a SIGN in the corner of the window as she hands him his food. Lester perches at a booth with the SUPERVISOR, a slick youth wearing a white short sleeve shirt and a tie covered with the Mr. Smiley’s emblem, who examines Lester's application, confused. Later, Carolyn and Buddy are in bed, post-coitus, laughing. Carolyn sits up, eager to learn from the maestro, and swiftly picks up her cue, kissing him and prepared for another round. Ricky and Jane stroll along without speaking; he seems comfortable with the silence while she doesn't. They halt walking and after a beat, a vehicle FUNERAL PROCESSION appears and begins to pass them gradually, which they observe. Barbara Fitts perches at the kitchen desk, staring off into space as if hypnotized, while Ricky enters, followed by Jane. Barbara's eyes flutter and she turns to him slowly, with Jane glancing around at the immaculate room where GLASS CASES filled with FIREARMS line the walls. Ricky crosses to a built-in CABINET behind the bureau, unlocks it, and opens it, revealing shelves stacked with WAR MEMORABILIA. He reaches into the cabinet, carefully removes an oval CHINA TRAY, and hands it to Jane, who examines it closely. On the bottom of the dish, a small SWASTIKA is imprinted in the center. Ricky puts the tray back into the cabinet and shuts the door, noticing Jane looking at him peculiarly, and studies her. Finally, we're in an empty parking lot on a cold, gray day, with something drifting across from us: an empty, crumpled, white PLASTIC BAG.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Carolyn is seated at a table, lost in thought, with two menus placed on the table. After a moment, she is joined by Buddy Kane, the Real Estate King, and warmth and graciousness immediately fill Carolyn. A smile is given by her, genuinely touched that her name is remembered by him, and her menu is picked up mechanically, with her gaze continuing to be fixed on Buddy, enraptured. Ricky stands with his DIGICAM, as he videotapes a DEAD BIRD decomposing on the ground. The camera is jerked up by him to discover Jane and Angela staring at us, and Jane is looked at by Angela, while she tries not to laugh, then the frame is exited by her as we zoom toward Jane. The Digicam is lowered by Ricky, and Angela starts off, but she isn't followed by Jane while a smile is given to her by Ricky. Angela stops and stares at her. In another scene, sex is being had by Carolyn and Buddy. Meanwhile, a joint is smoked by Lester while driving his TOYOTA CAMRY, cruising through the streets. The volume on the stereo is turned down by Lester, and he pulls the car around to the WINDOW, where a teenage GIRL wearing a headset waits, money is paid by him to her, and a SIGN in the corner of the window is noticed by him as she hands him his food. A booth is sat at by Lester with the MANAGER, a greasy kid wearing a white short sleeve shirt and a tie covered with the Mr. Smiley's logo, who looks over Lester's application, baffled. Later, Carolyn and Buddy lie in bed, post-sex, laughing. Carolyn sits up, eager to learn from the master, and her cue is quickly picked up by her, as he is kissed by her, ready for another round. Ricky and Jane walk along without speaking; he seems comfortable with the silence while she is not. They stop walking and, after a beat, an automobile FUNERAL PROCESSION is seen by them to appear and begin to pass them slowly, which they watch. Barbara Fitts is seated at the kitchen table, staring off into space as if hypnotized, while Ricky enters, and he is followed by Jane. Barbara's eyes flutter and she slowly turns to him, with Jane glancing around at the spotless room where GLASS CASES filled with GUNS line the walls. Ricky crosses to a built-in CABINET behind the desk, unlocks and opens it, revealing shelves stacked with WAR MEMORABILIA. He reaches into the cabinet, removes an oval CHINA PLATTER carefully, and hands it to Jane, who closely examines it. On the bottom of the plate, a small SWASTIKA is imprinted in the center. The platter is put back into the cabinet by Ricky and the door is shut, noticing Jane looking at him oddly, and he studies her. Finally, we're in an empty parking lot on a cold, gray day, with something floating across from us: an empty, wrinkled, white PLASTIC BAG.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Carolyn sits at a table, lost in thought, with two menus. Buddy Kane, the Real Estate King, joins her, and Carolyn becomes warm and gracious, smiling as he remembers her name. She picks up her menu, still enraptured by Buddy. Ricky films a decomposing bird with his DIGICAM, then captures Jane and Angela, who tries not to laugh. Angela leaves, but Jane stays as Ricky smiles at her. In another scene, Carolyn and Buddy are having sex. Barbara turns to Ricky slowly, while Jane observes the spotless room with GLASS CASES of GUNS. Ricky unlocks a CABINET, revealing WAR MEMORABILIA, and hands Jane a CHINA PLATTER with a SWASTIKA. Ricky returns the platter, noticing Jane's odd look. Finally, in an empty parking lot on a cold, gray day, a wrinkled, white PLASTIC BAG floats across.

She picks up her menu, staring at Buddy. Ricky films a decomposing bird with his DIGICAM, then captures Jane and Angela, who tries not to laugh. Lester drives his TOYOTA CAMRY, smoking a joint, and pays a teenage GIRL for food at a WINDOW, noticing a SIGN. Lester sits with the MANAGER, a greasy kid in a Mr. Smiley's shirt, who reviews his application. Later, Carolyn and Buddy laugh in bed, and she eagerly kisses him for another round. Ricky and Jane walk silently, stopping to watch a FUNERAL PROCESSION. Barbara Fitts sits at the kitchen table, hypnotized, as Ricky and Jane enter. Barbara turns to Ricky, and Jane glances at the spotless room with GLASS CASES of GUNS. Ricky unlocks a CABINET, revealing WAR MEMORABILIA, and hands Jane a CHINA PLATTER with a SWASTIKA. Ricky returns the platter, noticing Jane's odd look. Finally, in an empty parking lot on a cold day, a wrinkled PLASTIC BAG floats.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Carolyn finds herself seated at a table, deeply absorbed in her own thoughts, with not one but two menus laid out before her. After a brief moment, Buddy Kane, famously known as the Real Estate King, joins her at the table. Carolyn's demeanor instantly shifts to one of warmth and graciousness. She beams with a smile, genuinely moved by the fact that he remembers her name. Mechanically, she picks up her menu, yet her gaze remains fixed on Buddy, utterly captivated by his presence.

Meanwhile, Ricky stands nearby, holding his DIGICAM, as he records the unsettling sight of a DEAD BIRD slowly decomposing on the ground. Suddenly, the camera jerks upward to reveal Jane and Angela staring directly at us. Angela glances at Jane, trying to suppress her laughter, but eventually, she falls out of the frame as the camera zooms in on Jane. Ricky then lowers the Digicam, and Angela begins to walk away, but Jane remains in place while Ricky offers her a smile. Angela pauses and turns to look at her friend.

In a different scene, Carolyn and Buddy are engaged in the throes of passion. At the same time, Lester is behind the wheel, driving his TOYOTA CAMRY while casually smoking a joint, leisurely cruising through the streets. Lester turns down the volume on the stereo, maneuvers the car around to the WINDOW, where a teenage GIRL wearing a headset is waiting. He pays her and notices a SIGN in the corner of the window as she hands him his food.

Later, Lester finds himself seated at a booth with the MANAGER, a greasy young man clad in a white short-sleeve shirt and a tie emblazoned with the Mr. Smiley's logo. The manager looks over Lester's application with a baffled expression. In a subsequent scene, Carolyn and Buddy are in bed, post-coital, sharing laughter. Carolyn eagerly sits up, keen to learn from the master, and quickly picks up her cue, kissing him and ready for another round.

Elsewhere, Ricky and Jane walk side by side in silence; he appears at ease with the quiet, while she seems less so. They come to a stop, and after a brief pause, an automobile FUNERAL PROCESSION emerges, slowly passing by them, capturing their attention.

In another setting, Barbara Fitts sits at the kitchen table, her gaze distant as if she were in a trance, while Ricky enters the room, followed by Jane. Barbara's eyes flutter open, and she turns to him slowly, with Jane casting glances around the immaculate room where GLASS CASES filled with GUNS line the walls. Ricky moves to a built-in CABINET behind the desk, unlocks it, and opens it, revealing shelves filled with WAR MEMORABILIA. He carefully reaches into the cabinet, retrieves an oval CHINA PLATTER, and hands it to Jane, who examines it closely. On the bottom of the plate, a small SWASTIKA is imprinted in the center. Ricky returns the platter to the cabinet and closes the door, noticing Jane's peculiar look, and he studies her intently.

Finally, we find ourselves in an empty parking lot on a cold, gray day, with something peculiar floating across from us: an empty, wrinkled, white PLASTIC BAG, drifting aimlessly in the wind.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Carolyn finds herself seated comfortably at a table, deeply immersed in her own thoughts, with not just one but two menus strategically laid out in front of her. After a brief moment, Buddy Kane, who is widely recognized and famously known as the illustrious Real Estate King, casually joins her at the table, taking his seat. Carolyn's demeanor undergoes an immediate and notable shift to one of warmth and graciousness. She beams with a radiant smile, genuinely moved by the fact that he, Buddy Kane, remembers her name. Mechanically, she picks up her menu, yet her gaze remains steadily fixed on Buddy, utterly captivated and entranced by his presence.

Meanwhile, Ricky stands not too far away, holding his trusty DIGICAM as he meticulously records the unsettling and somewhat disturbing sight of a DEAD BIRD slowly decomposing on the ground. Suddenly, the camera jerks upward, revealing Jane and Angela standing there, staring directly at us. Angela glances sideways at Jane, trying to suppress a fit of laughter, but eventually, she tumbles out of the frame as the camera precisely zooms in on Jane. Ricky then carefully lowers the Digicam, and Angela begins to walk away, but Jane remains rooted in place while Ricky offers her a gentle smile. Angela pauses for a moment and turns back to look at her friend.

In a different scene, Carolyn and Buddy find themselves thoroughly engaged in the throes of passion. At the same time, Lester is behind the wheel, driving his reliable TOYOTA CAMRY while casually enjoying a joint, leisurely cruising through the bustling streets. Lester reaches out and turns down the volume on the stereo, skillfully maneuvering the car around to the WINDOW, where a teenage GIRL wearing a headset is patiently waiting. He pays her and notices a SIGN discreetly placed in the corner of the window as she hands him his food.

Later on, Lester finds himself comfortably seated at a booth with the MANAGER, a greasy young man clad in a stark white short-sleeve shirt and a tie boldly emblazoned with the Mr. Smiley's logo. The manager looks over Lester's application with a thoroughly baffled expression. In a subsequent scene, Carolyn and Buddy are in bed, post-coital, sharing a moment of laughter. Carolyn eagerly sits up, keen to learn from the master, and quickly picks up her cue, kissing him passionately and ready for another round.

Elsewhere, Ricky and Jane walk quietly side by side in silence; he appears entirely at ease with the quiet, while she seems less comfortable. They come to a stop, and after a brief pause, an automobile FUNERAL PROCESSION emerges, slowly passing by them, capturing their undivided attention.

In another setting altogether, Barbara Fitts sits serenely at the kitchen table, her gaze distant as if she were in a trance, while Ricky enters the room, followed closely by Jane. Barbara's eyes flutter open, and she turns to him slowly, with Jane casting careful glances around the immaculate room where GLASS CASES filled with GUNS line the walls. Ricky moves to a built-in CABINET behind the desk, unlocks it, and opens it, revealing neat shelves filled with WAR MEMORABILIA. He carefully reaches into the cabinet, retrieves an oval CHINA PLATTER, and hands it to Jane, who examines it closely. On the bottom of the plate, a small SWASTIKA is imprinted precisely in the center. Ricky returns the platter to the cabinet and closes the door, noticing Jane's peculiar look, and he studies her intently.

Finally, we find ourselves in an expansive, empty parking lot on a cold, gray day, with something peculiar floating across from us: an empty, wrinkled, white PLASTIC BAG, drifting aimlessly in the unpredictable wind.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Carolyn sits at a table, her mind adrift in contemplation, with two menus lying in front of her. After a brief moment, Buddy Kane, known as the Real Estate King, approaches and joins her at the table. Instantly, Carolyn's demeanor shifts to one of warmth and graciousness. She smiles, genuinely moved by the fact that Buddy remembers her name, and she picks up her menu in a mechanical fashion, her gaze fixed on Buddy, captivated by his presence. Meanwhile, Ricky stands nearby, holding his DIGICAM, as he records a DEAD BIRD decomposing on the ground. Suddenly, the camera jerks upward, revealing Jane and Angela staring directly at us. Angela glances at Jane, trying to suppress her laughter, but then she falls out of the frame as the camera zooms in on Jane. Ricky lowers the Digicam, and Angela begins to walk away, but Jane remains in place while Ricky smiles at her. Angela pauses and turns to stare at Jane. In another scene, Carolyn and Buddy are engaged in the midst of a sexual encounter. At the same time, Lester is driving his TOYOTA CAMRY, casually smoking a joint as he cruises through the streets. He reaches over to turn down the volume on the stereo, then maneuvers the car around to a WINDOW, where a teenage GIRL wearing a headset is waiting. He pays her and, as she hands him his food, he notices a SIGN in the corner of the window. Later, Lester finds himself sitting at a booth with the MANAGER, a greasy kid clad in a white short-sleeve shirt and a tie emblazoned with the Mr. Smiley's logo, who is scrutinizing Lester's application with a baffled expression. Subsequently, Carolyn and Buddy are seen in bed, post-coitus, sharing a laugh. Carolyn sits up, eager to absorb knowledge from the master, and quickly picks up on her cue, leaning in to kiss him, ready for another round. Elsewhere, Ricky and Jane walk side by side in silence; Ricky appears at ease with the quiet, while Jane does not. They come to a halt, and after a moment, an automobile FUNERAL PROCESSION emerges and begins to pass them slowly, capturing their attention. Meanwhile, Barbara Fitts sits at the kitchen table, her gaze distant and trance-like, as if under a spell, when Ricky enters the room, followed by Jane. Barbara's eyes flutter open, and she turns to Ricky slowly, while Jane surveys the immaculate room, noting the GLASS CASES filled with GUNS that line the walls. Ricky moves toward a built-in CABINET behind the desk, unlocks it, and opens it to reveal shelves filled with WAR MEMORABILIA. He reaches inside, carefully extracts an oval CHINA PLATTER, and hands it to Jane, who examines it closely. On the bottom of the plate, she notices a small SWASTIKA imprinted in the center. Ricky then returns the platter to the cabinet and closes the door, observing Jane's peculiar expression as she looks at him, prompting him to study her in return. Finally, the scene shifts to an empty parking lot on a cold, gray day, where something drifts across our view: an empty, wrinkled, white PLASTIC BAG.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Carolyn sits at a table, lost in thought with two menus, until Buddy Kane, the Real Estate King, joins her. She becomes warm and gracious, smiling as she picks up her menu, captivated by Buddy's presence. Meanwhile, Ricky films a decomposing bird with his DIGICAM, then shifts focus to Jane and Angela, who are watching him. Angela tries not to laugh and moves out of frame as Ricky zooms in on Jane. Ricky lowers the camera, smiling at Jane, while Angela pauses, waiting for her. In another scene, Carolyn and Buddy are engaged in an intimate moment. Simultaneously, Lester drives his TOYOTA CAMRY, smoking a joint, and turns down the stereo as he approaches a drive-thru window. He pays a teenage girl for his food and notices a sign in the window. Later, Lester sits with a manager reviewing his job application. Afterward, Carolyn and Buddy, post-intimacy, share laughter and Carolyn eagerly engages him for more. Ricky and Jane walk in silence until they stop to watch a passing funeral procession. At home, Barbara Fitts sits at the kitchen table, seemingly hypnotized, as Ricky and Jane enter. Barbara slowly acknowledges Ricky, while Jane observes the spotless room lined with glass cases of guns. Ricky unlocks a cabinet, revealing war memorabilia, and hands Jane a china platter with a swastika imprint, which she examines closely. Ricky returns the platter, noticing Jane's curious gaze. Finally, in an empty parking lot on a cold, gray day, an empty, wrinkled, white plastic bag floats across the scene.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Carolyn sits at a table, lost in thought, with two menus on the table at a popular upscale restaurant known for its lavish brunches. After a moment, Buddy Kane, who earned the nickname the Real Estate King due to his extensive property portfolio across the state, joins her. Carolyn immediately becomes warm and gracious. She smiles, genuinely touched that he remembers her name from a brief encounter at a recent industry gala, and picks up her menu mechanically, continuing to stare at Buddy, enraptured. Ricky stands with his DIGICAM, a popular handheld camcorder from the late 1990s, videotaping a DEAD BIRD decomposing on the ground, an action that reflects his fascination with capturing the raw and unfiltered aspects of life. The camera jerks up to discover Jane and Angela staring at us, and Angela looks at Jane, trying not to laugh, then falls out of frame as we zoom toward Jane. Ricky lowers the Digicam, and Angela starts off, but Jane doesn't follow, while Ricky smiles at her, intrigued by her quiet intensity. Angela stops and stares at her. In another scene, Carolyn and Buddy are in the middle of sex in a luxurious hotel suite with a panoramic view of the city. Meanwhile, Lester is driving, smoking a joint in his TOYOTA CAMRY, a reliable sedan popular among middle-class families, cruising through the suburban streets. Lester turns down the volume on the stereo, pulls the car around to the DRIVE-THRU WINDOW at a fast-food restaurant, where a teenage GIRL wearing a headset is waiting, pays her, and notices a SIGN in the corner of the window advertising the latest meal deal as she hands him his food. Lester sits at a booth with the MANAGER, a greasy kid wearing a white short sleeve shirt and a tie covered with the Mr. Smiley's logo, a fictional fast-food chain, who looks over Lester's application, baffled by his sudden interest in such a job. Later, Carolyn and Buddy are in bed, post-sex, laughing in a moment of relaxed intimacy. Carolyn sits up, eager to learn from the master of real estate, and quickly picks up her cue, kissing him and ready for another round. Ricky and Jane walk along without speaking; he seems comfortable with the silence while she doesn't, as the air between them is charged with unspoken tension. They stop walking and after a beat, an automobile FUNERAL PROCESSION appears, led by a hearse followed by a line of mourners' cars, and begins to pass them slowly, which they watch, both lost in thought. Barbara Fitts sits at the kitchen table, staring off into space as if hypnotized by her own thoughts, while Ricky enters, followed by Jane. Barbara's eyes flutter and she turns to him slowly, with Jane glancing around at the spotless room where GLASS CASES filled with GUNS, a reflection of her husband's military background, line the walls. Ricky crosses to a built-in CABINET behind the desk, unlocks it, and opens it, revealing shelves stacked with WAR MEMORABILIA from various conflicts, a testament to Colonel Fitts’ past. He reaches into the cabinet, carefully removes an oval CHINA PLATTER, an antique with a storied history, and hands it to Jane, who examines it closely. On the bottom of the plate, a small SWASTIKA is imprinted in the center, hinting at its unsettling origins from Nazi Germany. Ricky puts the platter back into the cabinet and shuts the door, noticing Jane looking at him oddly, and studies her with a penetrating gaze. Finally, we're in an empty parking lot on a cold, gray day, with something floating across from us: an empty, wrinkled, white PLASTIC BAG, caught in a gust of wind, swirling around in a hauntingly beautiful dance.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. Carolyn sits up eager to learn from the master and quickly picks up her cue kissing him and ready for another round. Ricky and Jane walk along without speaking. he seems comfortable with the silence while she does not. They stop walking and after a beat an automobile FUNERAL PROCESSION appears and begins to pass them slowly which they watch. Barbara Fitts sits at the kitchen table staring off into space as if hypnotized while Ricky enters followed by Jane. Barbara's eyes flutter and she turns to him slowly with Jane glancing around at the spotless room where GLASS CASES filled with GUNS line the walls. Ricky crosses to a builtin CABINET behind the desk unlocks it and opens it revealing shelves stacked with WAR MEMORABILIA. He reaches into the cabinet carefully removes an oval CHINA PLATTER and hands it to Jane who examines it closely. On the bottom of the plate a small SWASTIKA is imprinted in the center. Ricky puts the platter back into the cabinet and shuts the door noticing. Jane looking at him oddly and studies her. Finally we are in an empty parking lot on a cold gray day with something floating across from us an empty wrinkled white PLASTIC BAG.

Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Carolyn sits up eager to learn from the master and quickly picks up her cue kissing him and ready for another round. Ricky and Jane walk along without speaking. he seems comfortable with the silence while she does not. They stop walking and after a beat an automobile FUNERAL PROCESSION appears and begins to pass them slowly which they watch. Barbara Fitts sits at the kitchen table staring off into space as if hypnotized while Ricky enters followed by Jane. Barbara's eyes flutter and she turns to him slowly with Jane glancing around at the spotless room where GLASS CASES filled with GUNS line the walls. Ricky crosses to a builtin CABINET behind the desk unlocks it and opens it revealing shelves stacked with WAR MEMORABILIA. He reaches into the cabinet carefully removes an oval CHINA PLATTER and hands it to Jane who examines it closely. On the bottom of the plate a small SWASTIKA is imprinted in the center. Ricky puts the platter back into the cabinet and shuts the door noticing. Jane looking at him oddly and studies her. Finally we are in an empty parking lot on a cold gray day with something floating across from us an empty wrinkled white PLASTIC BAG.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Carolyn sits at a table lost in thought with two menus on the table. After a moment Buddy Kane the Real Estate King joins her and Carolyn immediately becomes warm and gracious. She smiles genuinely touched that he remembers her name and picks up her menu mechanically continuing to stare at Buddy enraptured. Ricky stands with his DIGICAM videotaping a DEAD BIRD decomposing on the ground. The camera jerks up to discover Jane and Angela staring at us and Angela looks at Jane trying not to laugh then falls out of frame as we zoom toward Jane. Ricky lowers the Digicam and Angela starts off but Jane does not follow while Ricky smiles at her. Ricky crosses to a builtin CABINET behind the desk unlocks it and opens it revealing shelves stacked with WAR MEMORABILIA. He reaches into the cabinet carefully removes an oval CHINA PLATTER and hands it to Jane who examines it closely. On the bottom of the plate a small SWASTIKA is imprinted in the center. Ricky puts the platter back into the cabinet and shuts the door noticing. Jane looking at him oddly and studies her. Finally we are in an empty parking lot on a cold gray day with something floating across from us an empty wrinkled white PLASTIC BAG.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: Carolyn sits at a table lost in thought with two menus on the table. After a moment Buddy Kane the Real Estate King joins her and Carolyn immediately becomes warm and gracious. She smiles genuinely touched that he remembers her name and picks up her menu mechanically continuing to stare at Buddy enraptured. Jane looking at him oddly and studies her. Finally we are in an empty parking lot on a cold gray day with something floating across from us an empty wrinkled white PLASTIC BAG.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Jasper perches on a bench, deeply amused, with two newspapers on the bench. After a moment, Charlie Smith, the Furniture Prince, approaches him, and Jasper immediately becomes chilly and formal. He frowns, genuinely surprised that he forgets his name, and picks up his newspaper energetically, continuing to gaze at Charlie, enthralled. Jeremy crouches with his MICROPHONE, audio-recording a LIVING FISH swimming in the pond. The microphone swings down to reveal Emma and Sophia gazing at us, and Sophia glances at Emma, trying not to sneeze, then hops out of view as we zoom toward Emma. Jeremy lifts the Microphone, and Sophia leaps off, but Emma doesn't trail while Jeremy winks at her. Sophia pauses and glares at her. In another scene, Jasper and Charlie are in the middle of a chess game. Meanwhile, Lucas is hiking, chewing a carrot in his HONDA ACCORD, trekking through the trails. Lucas turns up the heat in the vehicle, steers the car toward the BRIDGE, where a young LAD sporting a whistle is lingering, greets him, and observes a BILLBOARD in the corner of the bridge as he passes him his drink. Lucas stands at a counter with the SALESCLERK, a shiny woman wearing a red long-sleeve jacket and a scarf adorned with the Happy Faces emblem, who glances over Lucas's resume, puzzled. Later, Jasper and Charlie are in the garden, post-game, chuckling. Jasper stands up, eager to listen to the novice, and slowly picks up his line, patting him and ready for another challenge. Jeremy and Emma stroll along without talking; he seems unsettled with the calmness while she doesn't. They halt strolling and after a pause, a bicycle PARTY CARAVAN appears and starts to pass them swiftly, which they ignore. Marissa Costa perches at the dining table, glaring into space as if spellbound, while Jeremy sneaks in, tailed by Emma. Marissa's eyelids flutter and she turns to him quickly, with Emma peering around at the cluttered space where WOODEN CRATES filled with BOOKS line the windows. Jeremy traverses to a hanging MIRROR beside the library, locks it, and unfolds it, revealing baskets piled with SPORTS EQUIPMENT. He reaches into the mirror, gingerly extracts an oblong CERAMIC VASE, and presents it to Emma, who scrutinizes it briefly. On the bottom of the vase, a small PINEAPPLE is etched in the center. Jeremy places the vase back into the mirror and seals the entrance, observing Emma watching him curiously, and analyzes her. Eventually, we're in a crammed warehouse on a warm, blue afternoon, with something drifting above us: a crowded, crumpled, red RUBBER BALLOON.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Carolyn sits with Buddy Kane, the Real Estate King, becoming warm and gracious when he remembers her name. Ricky films a dead bird, then Jane, causing Angela to laugh and leave. Carolyn and Buddy share intimate moments, showcasing their growing connection. Meanwhile, Lester smokes a joint while driving his Camry, visiting a fast-food drive-through and applying for a job. Carolyn and Buddy find themselves in bed again, eager to learn from each other. Ricky and Jane walk silently, observing a funeral procession. At home, Barbara Fitts appears entranced as Ricky and Jane enter a spotless room lined with glass cases of guns. Ricky shows Jane a china platter with a swastika on it, which she examines curiously. Finally, an empty plastic bag drifts across a cold, gray parking lot.
